item.title: Funding from Agencia I+D+i (Argentina) for retinar
item.description: We received funding through the 2021 call for PICT start-ups from Agencia Nacional para la Promoción de la Investigación, el Desarrollo Científico y la Innovación (Agencia I+D+i) to fund our research in retinar, under the supervision of Dr.

item.title: retinar was awarded by NVIDIA Corporation
item.description: retinar was selected as member of the NVIDIA Applied Research Accelerator Program. Our project, entitled “retinar: assisting remote diabetic retinopathy screening with AI tools”, our joint initiative between UNICEN and Hospital El Cruce was awarded with 500 hours on V100 GPU instances via SaturnCloud.

item.title: We are one of the 15 projects in the next round of Prendete!
item.description: We are happy to announce that retinar is one of the 15 innovative ideas that were selected among other 130 proyects to participate in the next round of Prendete 2020.

item.title: We're participating in Prendete
item.description: To further boost retinar and benefit the implementation of our solution, we’re thrilled to announce that we’re participating from the 2020 edition of Prendete, the contest of innovative business ideas.

item.title: Our website is online!
item.description: We’re very excited to announce the launch of our website! This is yet another tool to keep you updated about our latest news.

item.title: Jose Ignacio Orlando
item.description: José Ignacio Orlando (Nacho) received his Software Engineering degree in 2013 at Universidad Nacional del Centro de la Provincia de Buenos Aires (UNICEN) in Tandil, Argentina.
